tasks.task: Participate in a training workshop on vegetable grafting.
subtasks: Attend the theoretical session.
Listen to lectures on local grafting research.
Learn about grafting tomatoes and sweet peppers on various rootstocks.
Understand performance benefits against biotic and abiotic stresses.
Apply vegetable grafting techniques under guidance.

tasks.task: Receive training on Integrated Pest Management (IPM).
subtasks: Learn why IPM reduces reliance on chemicals.
Understand how vegetable grafting can protect crops from diseases.
Grasp the potential of grafting to reduce crop loss and pesticide expenses.
Recognize the link between grafting techniques and food security.

tasks.task: Engage in farmer recommendations for varieties suitable for grafting.
subtasks: Discuss with facilitators varieties suggested for grafting.

tasks.task: Absorb principles taught for immediate application.
subtasks: Implement learned grafting methods on their farms.

theoretical and practical. So, maybe separate those into subtasks. Also, farmers immediately apply what's taught, suggesting_SUBTASK: recognizing the farmer's engagement and recommendations. Another subtask could be applying the principles taught on their own farms. MAINTASK: Participate in a training workshop on vegetable grafting.
subtasks: Attend the theoretical session.
Listen to lectures on the work done locally on grafting vegetables.
Learn about grafting tomatoes and sweet peppers on various rootstocks.
Understand performance benefits against biotic and abiotic stresses.
Apply vegetable grafting techniques under guidance.

subtasks: Learn why IPM reduces reliance on chemicals.
Understand how vegetable grafting can protect crops from diseases.
Grasp the potential of grafting to reduce crop loss and pesticide expenses.
